title: Directive Zero Unleashed
story_summary: Halden's secret failsafe locks everyone out of the BCI. Monitoring stops and the city is thrown open. People flood the streets, debate and vote on their future. The Council loses control. In the end, citizens demand a new system with real oversight and the old order cannot resist.

official.headline: System Pause Declared
official.anchor_line: BCI enforcement is temporarily suspended as Directive Zero activates citywide.
official.contextual_reframing: In a spirit of transparency and collective purpose, Stenograd enters a rare phase of open participation for all residents.

official.headline: Citizens Unite Publicly
official.anchor_line: A binding citywide vote is announced, inviting public debate and engagement on automated governance.
official.contextual_reframing: Stenograd's social fabric proves its strength as open dialogue and civic engagement take center stage.

official.headline: Council Yields to Change
official.anchor_line: The Council recognizes the people's choice for a renewed system with greater oversight and openness.
official.contextual_reframing: The system adapts to safeguard unity, demonstrating resilience and collective progress at this historic turning point.

underground.headline: Lights Out. Eyes Open.
underground.anchor_line: Directive Zero hits - no more BCI, no more automated control.
underground.contextual_reframing: Halden's secret switch flips and the whole network goes dark. What else have they been hiding from us?

underground.headline: Voices Break the Silence
underground.anchor_line: Real debate floods the city for the first time. People actually get to choose.
underground.contextual_reframing: No screens telling us what to think - just raw arguments, hope, and fear. The city's waking up, and nobody knows what comes next.

underground.headline: System Collapse. Now What?
underground.anchor_line: The Council loses its grip, forced to face the public for once. The future hangs wide open.
underground.contextual_reframing: For the first time, Stenograd belongs to its people - at least, for now. Don't look away. This is history in motion.
